fields.description:
*Steps to replicate:*
Plan a story in a sprint and start the sprint
Convert the story to an Epic.

You will notice the epic ticket is showing up as a workable item in the Work Board.

Because it is no longer a story, it should no longer appear in the Work Board.

*Workaround:*
Manually edit the Sprint field of the issue to remove it from the sprint.

fields.description:
Within the plan tab, we'd like to have the following lists
- Current sprint (already exists)
- Backlog (already exists)
- Unprioritized (doesn't exist, would include untriaged bugs, features, stories, etc. that aren't ready for development)

I know I can create quick filters that would show any combination of issues, but we'd prefer to easily drag issues between two backlog-type lists; this is versus opening the untriaged issue in a separate window and changing it's state to "Ready for Development" to make it show up in a filtered backlog 

Thanks!

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

Getting error when trying to access JIRA Agile Release Burndown report using  Internet Explorer version 9 - 11. The browser got stuck and the user couldn't do anything.

Error details:
{noformat}
Exception: Object doesn't support property or method 'split'
Resource: https://dsj4qznkp7ma3.cloudfront.net/richie.jira-dev.com/s/09c02405ecd6e3bda3cc84c0506ebade-CDN/en_US-m8926w/64003/28/cc3c7201d17cfda23c7b1ecca05cb358/_/download/contextbatch/js/jira.general,-greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,-atl.general,-gh-rapid,-jira.project.sidebar,-jira.global/batch.js?analyticsEnabled=true&jag_disabled_marketing=true&locale=en-US&admin_agent_needed=true
Line: 8
Exception: Object doesn't support property or method 'split'
Resource: https://dsj4qznkp7ma3.cloudfront.net/richie.jira-dev.com/s/09c02405ecd6e3bda3cc84c0506ebade-CDN/en_US-m8926w/64003/28/cc3c7201d17cfda23c7b1ecca05cb358/_/download/contextbatch/js/jira.general,-greenhopper-rapid-non
-gadget,-atl.general,-gh-rapid,-jira.project.sidebar,-jira.global/batch.js?analyticsEnabled=true&jag_disabled_marketing=true&locale=en-US&admin_agent_needed=true
Line: 8
Exception: Object doesn't support property or method 'split'
Resource: https://dsj4qznkp7ma3.cloudfront.net/richie.jira-dev.com/s/09c02405ecd6e3bda3cc84c0506ebade-CDN/en_US-m8926w/64003/28/cc3c7201d17cfda23c7b1ecca05cb358/_/download/contextbatch/js/jira.general,-greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,-atl.general,-gh-rapid,-jira.project.sidebar,-jira.global/batch.js?analyticsEnabled=true&jag_disabled_marketing=true&locale=en-US&admin_agent_needed=true
{noformat}

This problem does not affect other supported browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari).

h3. Cause

Javascript errors are being caused by a library that is included on the page by Service Desk.

h3. Work around

* Use a different browser.
* If you have Service Desk installed but you are not using it, you can temporarily disable Service Desk to restore access to reports.

fields.description:
In Version report, users can see both Epics and standard Issues, but there's no way to categorize or reorder them. It looks like that issues are automatically ordered according to the order in which they are added to the version.

This is inflexible and makes it hard for users to track the version's progress, especially when there're a lot of epics and issues. It would be easier if issues can be grouped by epics and there're more options to sort them i.e. to make it a better hierarchy.

Other than that, users might need the ability to add/remove columns to be displayed e.g. assignee, resolution. It's good if they can also see the percentage of completion of every epic so that they don't have to switch between Epic report and Version report so often.
fields.summary: Version Report should be customizable

fields.description:
A customer was confused by this error message showing on his board: "Due to the configuration for this particular board, you'll have to use the full dialog to create a new issue. Learn more" 

Apparently this displays if there are no projects or issue types detected, which is most likely due to the board's filter filtering them out.

The Learn more links to a general page on Configuring boards, but I think we should be more specific in the error message. Suggested text:
"You will need to use the full dialog to create a new issue, as your board's filter is excluding all projects and/or issue types."
fields.summary: Improve the "Due to the configuration for this particular board, you'll have to use the full dialog to create a new issue.Learn more" error message

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Scenario: Our project utilizes epics. which are broken into features. Those features are further broken into sub-tasks. We estimate _only_ on the sub-tasks when sub-tasks exist as they are the only items granular enough to be worth of estimations.

However, estimates made on sub-tasks are not accounted for in the JIRA Agile Planning board. This means that we are unable to see how much time we have allocated to any given sprint.

This is easily reproducible. Create 1 Epic with 1 Feature with 1 Sub-Task and provide an estimate on the sub-task. Then view the Epic/Feature on JIRA Agile's Planning Board.

The details breakdown in the Epic and Sprint Reports suffer from the same problem. The issues list at the bottom does not tally a sub-tasks' estimated hours into the parent task.
fields.summary: Hours estimated on sub-tasks are not accounted for in the planning board's Original Estimate fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Client Description:


I just created a new project in our instance of JIRA, called Product Backlog (project key = PB) and we have over 60 issues in the project backlog. However, none of the issues in the project backlog show up in the Plan view for JIRA Agile. 

I have already checked to ensure that no quick filters are applied, issues are not in a "resolved" status that would preclude them from appearing. The workflow and issue type schemes are reused in other projects where issues do appear. I also switched the permission scheme to one that is shared and that did not help with the issues not appearing, so I don't think it's permissions.

I can run a query and see a list of issues so I know they're hiding in the project somewhere, but I'd love for them to show up in the plan view so that I can adjust priority from there, etc.

h2. Workaround:

When you create a scrum project and only have one column in your Work view, it causes all issues to be hidden in the Plan view. You must have at least two columns in the Work view (scrum board) in order for issues to show up in planning.
fields.summary: No tickets are showing up on the Plan view for JIRA Agile

JIRA Version 6.1.5/JIRA Agile Version 6.6.0
JDK 1.6 /*nix

On the Epic Burndown report, in the *Completed Issues* section below the graphic report, there is a list of completed issues that is organized by Sprint.  It has been observed that tickets that are no actually assigned to the listed Sprint are appearing under said Sprint.  For example, issue XXX-123 is listed as a completed ticket for Sprint YYZ, but if you click on issue XXX-123 and view the details, you will see that the issue is actually assigned to Sprint ABC.  The issue in question is listed on the Epic, however.  It is just listed under the wrong sprint.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11263].
  {panel}

When a JIRA Agile board is deleted, all sprints that are active on it cannot be deleted nor can reports from them be viewed.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a new Scrum Board
 # Create a sprint on the board and add issues.
 # Start the sprint.
 # Delete the board.
 # Sprint stays active and cannot be ended and report page is blank.
Active sprints from deleted boards are still displayed in the 'Sprint' field suggestions too, which may be confusing for the users.

*Expected behaviour*
When a user attempts to delete a board, show a notification about the active sprints and let them choose to either complete or remove the sprints, or keep them active.

*Workaround*
 # If there are issues associated with the sprints:
 ** Create a new board.
 ** Associate the filter of deleted board to new board.
 ** You can now end sprint from this board.
 # If there are no issues associated with the affected sprints:
 ** Create a test project
 ** Show sprint field on the field configuration of the test project
 ** Create new issue, associate with this new issue
 ** Create new board
 ** Associate test project with the board
 ** Now you can end the sprint from this board

(i) Although you can manually update the table to remove the board, but it is not recommended.
the sprints will need to be deleted with a manual update of the "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" table.

This sprint was showing up because it wasn't marked as closed, but the board it was on had been deleted.
{noformat}
jira=# select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT";
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE |   END_DATE    | ID |     NAME      | RAPID_VIEW_ID | STARTED |  START_DATE
--------+---------------+---------------+----+---------------+---------------+---------+---------------
 t      | 1393896023571 | 1393894020000 |  2 | Sprint 0      |             3 | t       | 1392079630319
 t      | 1397593903516 | 1394351160000 |  3 | Sprint 1      |             3 | t       | 1393919198734
 t      | 1397594141661 | 1397593980000 |  4 | Sprint 2      |             3 | t       | 1396384385510
 t      | 1399057753082 | 1398712020000 |  5 | Sprint 3      |             3 | t       | 1398107259097
 f      |               | 1399662840000 |  6 | Sprint 4      |             3 | t       | 1398798867723
 t      | 1410895731347 | 1393276980000 |  1 | Week 2 - 2/14 |             1 | t       | 1392067397490
 f      |               | 1411369140000 |  8 | Sprint 1      |             4 | t       | 1410159606021
(7 rows)

jira=# select * from "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW";
 CARD_COLOR_STRATEGY | ID |     NAME      | OWNER_USER_NAME | SAVED_FILTER_ID | SPRINTS_ENABLED | SPRINT_MARKERS_MIGRATED | SWIMLANE_STRATEGY
---------------------+----+---------------+-----------------+-----------------+-----------------+-------------------------+-------------------
 issuetype           |  1 | February 2014 | ted             |           10000 | t               | t                       | parentChild
 issuetype           |  2 | Operations    | aaron           |           10100 | f               | t                       | custom
 issuetype           |  4 | RevUp         | aaron           |           10200 | t               | t                       | parentChild
 issuetype           |  6 | Data          | aaron           |           10400 | t               | t                       | parentChild
 issuetype           |  8 | RevUp2        | msteffeck       |           10500 | t               | t                       | custom
(5 rows)
{noformat}
I created a new rapid board, and edited the "RAPID_VIEW_ID" line from that sprint to the new board id (11).
{noformat}
jira=# update "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" set "RAPID_VIEW_ID" = 11 where "ID" = 6;
UPDATE 1

jira=# select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "ID" = 6;
 CLOSED | COMPLETE_DATE |   END_DATE    | ID |   NAME   | RAPID_VIEW_ID | STARTED |  START_DATE
--------+---------------+---------------+----+----------+---------------+---------+---------------
 f      |               | 1399662840000 |  6 | Sprint 4 |            11 | t       | 1398798867723
(1 row)
{noformat}
This showed the sprint "Sprint 4" in the test board I created and allowed me to close it off. I did some tests on another instances and indeed, deleting a board while a sprint is active will leave the sprint orphaned.
fields.summary: After a Board Is Deleted, Related Sprints Remain Active

fields.description:
This method is intended to be a lightweight check of the number of existing issues and the maximum updated timestamp, but it can actually be quite expensive.  From a NewRelic profile taken by an enterprise customer:

!WorkDataFactoryPermissions.png!

This doesn't really need to check permissions, because the nastiest thing that can happen is that we leak information that some issue would be on their agile board if only they could see it.  It seems strange that a developer wouldn't have permission to see issues on their board in the first place, so filtering the count and last updated timestamp seems unnecessary, here.
fields.summary: WorkDataFactory.getWorkDataIssueCountAndLastUpdated does not need to check permissions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a Scrum Master, I would like the ability to change swimlanes with the click of a button to see progress of the Sprint from different perspectives. E.g. when trying to see how much progress each member of my team has made in their assigned tasks, I use the "Assignee" swimlane. When looking at the progress of a Story, I use the "Story" swimlane. It would be nice to be able to quickly change swimlanes to get different perspectives without having to create multiple boards or having to reconfigure the board.
fields.summary: Rapid board should have the ability to quickly change swimlanes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When customers with large instances are running an upgrade, some upgrade tasks can take a long time and no status for the task is logged.

This can cause users to think the upgrade is actually stuck as there's no indication that anything is happening or how long it's going to take.

It would be great if JIRA Agile could estimate how long the upgrade task will take at the beginning and every few minutes log a message showing it is still running and a new estimate for tasks that will take a long time.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like JIRA to estimate how long an upgrade task will take

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to customise the Start and End date formats for a sprint without changing the general JIRA date-time pickers.

Current options for customising the Start and End Date formats for a sprint would be 
* Customise date-time picker formats in the {{jira-config.properties}} - but this side effect for this is that all date/date-time pickers will be affected by this change.
* A second option would be to use Javascript injection using the Announcement Banner, which is quite messy.

It would be nice to have a setting in {{jira-config.properties}} to change only JIRA Agile sprint date-time pickers to use a custom format like "Year-Month-Day 00:00" using Java/Javascript date format specifiers to avoid JIRA-wide changes.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to customise the Start and End date formats for a sprint without affecting JIRA date-time pickers

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create an issue with Sub tasks
# View this issue on the rapid board.
# Through JIRA Agile view, try to move the issue to another project
# All steps execute fine but in the end the issue is still showing in the same project.

Note :
If the same issue is moved through JIRA (not JIRA Agile) then the issue is moved correctly. 
If another issue that does not have sub tasks is moved using JIRA Agile, then it gets moved correctly.


*Workaround*
Please move the issues through the JIRA interface for now.
fields.summary: Move issues between projects not working using Jira Agile board if the issue have subtasks

fields.description:
As a JIRA user, I would like to see my sprint burndown chart based on number of subtasks.
We are using story points as estimates, but in a sprint we have only few storys with many tasks. The current burndown based on story points is useless, because we don't want to add story points to the tasks. The burndown shows only few steps as we are resolving our tickets. If we could see the number of remaining tickets in our sprint, we would have an accurate burndown, similar what we had in classic greenhopper.

fields.description:
h1. Introduction
We are happily using your Agile plugin for years now and it is always a perfect fit and of great help to our agile development process.

There is just one thing that we are not able to match with our development process and that is (in our opinion) not structured correctly in JIRA Agile. Currently epics are not displayed in the backlog, but in the left EPIC bar. We would prefer to change this so that epics are displayed in the product backlog and the left bar is called differently (ie. "theme" would suit better).

h1. Why?
# An epic should not contain user stories as it actually is a big user story. Later on the epic is replaced by several user stories.
# An epic should be estimated to the same reference as a user story (if story x is 5 story points, than epic y is 100 story points)
# An epic should be prioritised accurately, so in between story 3 and story 4 of theme 1, it should be possible to place epic 1 of theme 2. By prioritizing the epics seperately from the other PBI's you suggest that you first need to finish an epic (or what we would call theme) before you start another.

h1. Solution
What we would like to change is:
# Add a new (default) issue type called "Theme"
# Change the left bar from epic to theme, so that you can still group backlog items and easily filter them.
# Put the actual epics back where they belong, in the backlog together with all other PBI's

We sincerely hope that you can help us out with this issue in some way as it concerns the foundations of how we structure our projects.

Thanks, also on behalf of our development teams,

Kai Stevens
fields.summary: Change the way epics are handled

fields.description:
At the moment it's possible for Users to add Issues to a Future Sprint from a different board. This causes a single sprint to be started on multiple boards with no indication that it's the same Sprint.

*How to Reproduce*
# Create 2 projects A and B both with separate Rapid Boards
# Create a planned Sprint on board A called Sprint Alpha
# Create a planned Sprint on board B called Sprint Beta
# Drag an issue on board A into the sprint
# Go to the *Issue View* in JIRA for an issue in Project B
# Edit the Sprint field, select Sprint Alpha (note that it does NOT warn you it's from a different project)
# Sprint Alpha will now appear on the Scrum board for Project B
# Start the Sprint in Board A
# The Sprint will now also be active in Board B
# Closing one sprint closes the other as well

There are a few results of this
* You need Project Admin for both boards to be able to start the sprint
* There is no indication on either board the Sprint contains issues from another board. Both boards act like it's their own contained sprint.
* Ending a sprint on one board requires Project Admin for both projects
* It LOOKS like sharing the same name causing sprints to be linked however it's the same sprint in both boards.

*Possible Solutions*
* Warn the user that the future sprint is from a different board
* Warn the user when starting a new sprint that it contains issues from a different board

*Workaround*
* Only assign Issues to Sprints from the Rapid Board
fields.summary: Users should be warned if a Sprint is started with issues from a different Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In previous versions, the name of the version would be shortened in the planning mode of the board. However, starting from JIRA Agile 6.6.0, it does not shorten it anymore. Instead, it shows the full name of the version, regardless of how long it is :

!versions.png|thumbnail!

As visible in the screenshot, this might interfere with the summary of the issue itself, causing confusion. It'd be great if the version names could be shortened back.
fields.summary: Version is not shortened anymore in planning mode of JIRA Agile 6.60

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We currently have a RapidBoard usability issue. Our team of developers is split between groups, but all work on the same project. When tickets get created they are assigned components and that usually determines which team works on the ticket. Sometimes a ticket will have more than one component however.

The team filters based on components, and when a ticket has two components it shows up on two boards; this is OK, this is actually what we want. What we don't want is to have the ticket appear on two boards when it is already part of a sprint. This leads to confusion as to which team a sprint belongs to, and tickets that are worked on by one team may get added to another team's sprint. 

We are suggesting that when a ticket gets added to a sprint it is taken from all other boards, and the sprint that it gets added to only shows up in on RapidBoard.
fields.summary: One ticket shows up in two RapidBoards

fields.summary: JS exception on RapidStart welcome mat

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm trying to delete an old sprint that is over but I can't delete it. I get the error message "This issue can't be deleted because of it's workflow status". I don't have any issues left in the sprint so I don't know why this is happening?

See attached screen shots.

My account is fredrik.hellstrom@jersey.se and I'm an admin for the Shoutly project.

We are using JIRA v6.1.7#6163

Best,
Fredrik
fields.summary: Can't delete old sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: On the "Work" board, near the top left, is the sprint name.  It has a small pulldown to allow you to edit the sprint dates.  However, there is no way to close that pulldown- it actually persists through changing to plan or report as well.  It does eventually time out, and it goes away if you click a link that requires a page refresh.
fields.summary: On the board 'Work' tab, sprint pulldown can't be closed.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After the update of JIRA Agile from 6.3.9.1 to 6.6.0, the "Rank" field was re-worked into a new Lexo rank field and the original field was re-named to "Rank (Obsolete)" as explained in the upgrade notes at : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.4+Upgrade+Notes.

Although it is safe to remove this field later, but the customer needs to go through the process of removing the field through the database. The upgrade process should automatically take care of deleting the field.
fields.summary: Rank (obsolete) fields should be unlocked so that they can be deleted

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Let us know what else you need to help determine cause.

NewRelic showing slow trace: http://screencast.com/t/CQ2O2ifDej
NewRelic showing http referral as "RapidBoard.jspa": http://screencast.com/t/En7CHnaph
NewRelic showing db trxn are quick: http://screencast.com/t/86b6EJvFduHU
fields.summary: Extremely Slow Performance with WorkResource.getPoolData() Traces

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Ever since going with 2.17+ of the Universal Plugin Manager, the updating of plugins always gets stuck and we have to refresh the page multiple times to actually get a plugin updated.

Currently we cannot even upgrade from 2.17.1 to 2.17.3 in production. We continue to get an error but it is hard to read the error because it disappears from the screen. 

It was working fine on 2.16
fields.summary: Universal Plugin Manager 2.17+ all updating plugins hang

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If subtasks exist in an issue, we estimate only these ones and not the parrent issue.
When I check the "epic report", the Original Time Estimate is 0 for the issue and this issue is counted for one unestimated issue ! (see attached file)

It could be really useful to have the addition of estimate values of each sub task in the report, like we can do when the parent issue is showed in the time tracking part (see attached file)
fields.summary: JIRA Agile should add the original time estimate of the subtasks included in a parent issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Agile boards not rolling uncompleted issues to next planned sprint even though sprints are planned for the rest of the year.
fields.summary: Agile Boards not rolling uncompleted issues to next sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-11209].
  {panel}

h3. Symptoms

This affects JIRA versions *6.3.4 and higher*, _regardless_ of the JIRA Agile version installed.

When viewing Agile boards in plan mode, by expanding the Versions session it is possible to click on the Description field to make it turn into a text box. After entering some value and hitting <enter> it looks like the description has been updated, however, when we refresh the page it gets back to the old value (or empty if there was no description before).

!before_changes.png!
!mouseover_description.png!
!description_entered.png!
!after_changes.png!

h3. Work around

Please edit version data through the Versions page in Project Administration.
fields.summary: Version name and Description fields are editable but they don’t save changes on Agile plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behaviour

When seeing the backlog inside a board in JIRA Agile 6.6, if the number of issues is high in the backlog, there should be a scrollbar to allow to check the issues in the bottom of the list.

h3. Actual Behaviour

When seeing the backlog inside a board in JIRA Agile 6.6, the page won't let the issues be scrolled down depending on the resolution of the screen and there is no way to check the issues in the bottom of the list.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile 6.6 scroll down Backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi JIRA Agile team,

The new feature released is great. It helps us a lot. But it will helps us even better if you guys implement the possibility to configure card layout by issue type.

Why this is important for us... Cause we use KANBAN boards for specific teams over here. One for Project Team, one for Support Team, one for Product Team and another one for the DEV Team.

According to our workflows one issue can pass from one KANBAN to other, due to its status or even its type.

Each KANBAN has a different focus and we believe its issues should have different visible informations as well.

An issue type of *DEV Task*, for example, should expose the information below as its extra fields:
- Due Date
- Original Estimate
- Time Spent.

On the other hand, an issue type of *Customer Request Support* should expose the information below as its extra fields:
- Responsible Support Attendant
- SLA related to Time to Respond

Hope your considerations. Regardless of all mentioned above. Congrats for the new feature, it's very useful! :)
fields.summary: It will be great if in the new feature: Configure Card Layout, I could make the configuration by issue type

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In 6.6.0 the option to customise cards in the new Agile boards was added, however the field I need to add is unavailable, it appears only fields which are available on all ticket types are available - this is a regression from the Classic boards, where I could add this field.

*Repro steps:*

# Add a custom field.
# Ensure it's setup to work with a project that uses a JIRA agile board.
# Customise the Agile board and try to add the newly created custom field.
> It works!
# Modify the custom field to only be applicable to one ticket type, Story for instance.
# Now try and add the custom field to the ticket.
> The field is no longer available.

The use case is that sub-tasks have a different set of fields to regular issue types.

Ideally if a field is not available for an issue type then it just wouldn't appear, but if it just had 'EMPTY' that would be fine also.

I've put priority as major as this will block us moving from the classic boards.
fields.summary: Custom Field cannot be added to a Card unless it's applicable for all ticket types

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The 6.6.0 Agile boards added the 'Workload by assignee' table, which is amazing and should solve a lot of our problems regarding dealing with specialists on the boards.

We use Original Time Estimate as our primary estimation statistic, as opposed to Story points.

I need this tool to tell me how much time people are taking on in to the sprint, NOT how much the issue had assigned to it in total. 

If I had a ticket with a 2 day estimate that rolled over from the previous sprint with 4 hours remaining on it, then that's only 4 hours that individual has on them in them in the next sprint - that's the information I need to be able to see.

Set this as a blocker because this is absolutely key to our workflow and will prevent us moving from the classic boards.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I need workload by assignee in Remaining Time Estimate, not Original Time Estimate

fields.description:
Where I have a need for 3 separate quick filters, all variants on status, I have buttons for "Resolved and Closed" "Closed" and "Resolved not Closed" for instance.
These could far more logically be presented as a set of choices in a drop down, with the addition of "Not applied" or "None" etc. Each choice would simply be a different quick filter definition and description. This would also ensure the control was actually displaying the state being applied, rather than the current, somewhat confusing highlighting where the single description can lead to misinterpretation.
By extension the control would need a descriptive title as well.
One could envisage 3 customers being important for now, so a 'Customer' title control would have 'All', 'Cust1','Cust2','Cust5' for instance relating to 3 separate, very similar quick filter queries. 
This would significantly reduce clutter, and would even help with single On Off type quick filters, where description would change.
An advantage of this approach is not having to link the quick filters to lookup selectors, and additionally, the drop down could even use very dissimilar quick filters at the same time if required.
fields.summary: Enhance Quick Filter display and capabilities

fields.description:
We have been using the Classic boards but as these are now on the chopping block I'm looking at the new boards.

The new burndown graph is too noisy and is confusing for some stake holders/managers who used to occasionally check burndown charts on the Classic boards.

I have a team of 11 who are, fortunately, very good at logging time - this means that during the day there's a very tight clustering of data points, which makes it almost impossible to meaningfully inspect the points, but that's then followed by a flatline representing out of office hours. 

If there was an OPTION to consolidate each day in to a single data point that'd be ideal. I've attached a screenshot of the classic vs new chart (using same team data, though sprint for new chart starts a day later).
fields.summary: Option to simplify Burndown chart to a single daily data point (like the Classic boards)
